node.title: International Space Station to crash into the Pacific Ocean in 2031, NASA says
node.description: NASA plans to crash the International Space Station into an uninhabited part of the Pacific Ocean called Point Nemo.

node.title: 'We're so late now': Nursing boss, National critical of job campaign timing
node.description: An overseas recruitment campaign targeting specialist nurses will go live this week, but critics say it's far too late two years into the pandemic.

node.title: Scientists working on single test to detect risk of four cancers in women
node.description: Researchers are working on a screening test to predict the risk of four cancers in women from samples collected from a routine cervical screening. Audio

node.title: Plans to replace two Hamilton schools with new one
node.description: Education Minister Chris Hipkins said he was satisfied building a new school was in the best interests of south-west Hamilton.

node.title: Democrats Break With Leaders Over Congressional Stock Trading
node.description: With top House Democrats skeptical of barring lawmakers from owning individual stocks, a simmering issue has exploded, especially among members facing difficult re-election races.

node.title: EU moves to label nuclear and gas as sustainable
node.description: Nuclear and natural gas energy plants could be counted as "green energy" under controversial EU plans just unveiled.

node.title: Mississippi governor signs bill legalizing medical marijuana
node.description: The state is the 37th in the nation to establish a medical marijuana program, according to the National Conference of State Legislatures​.

node.title: Oath Keepers founder spends 6 hours with House January 6 Committee
node.description: Rhodes has been charged with seditious conspiracy and other crimes stemming from his alleged involvement in the Capitol breach.

node.title: Meta stock plummets after weak earnings report
node.description: The company spent over $10 billion on the Metaverse in 2021.

node.title: Royal souvenirs have 'Platinum Jubbly' misprint
node.description: A spelling mistake on thousands of pieces of Platinum Jubilee merchandising, calling it the "Platinum Jubbly", is proving a challenge for souvenir sellers.

node.title: 'There will be life after Covid' - PM reveals decision for NZ's border reopening
node.description: Jacinda Ardern has outlined the details about when New Zealand's borders will reopen.

node.title: IPCA staff member loses USB stick with complaint information
node.description: An Independent Police Conduct Authority staff member has lost a USB stick with information on complainants and police, in what is being treated as a security and privacy breach.

node.title: Farmers urged to plan for Covid-19 to reduce supply chain disruption
node.description: As New Zealand farmers prepare for Omicron cases to rise, an Australian farming leader says dealing with the virus is difficult but being flexible is key.

node.title: Local town centres flourish as Covid-19 restrictions force work from home
node.description: A retail property broker says the pandemic is driving a resurgence in smaller suburban retail hubs.

node.title: From heartbreak to TikTok stardom: The amazing journey of the LSU Tiger Girls
node.description: One year after not being allowed to compete, LSU's dance team took home the 2022 UDA National Championship with a routine dedicated to fighting sexism in college athletics.

node.title: Covid-19: Mythbusting the booster recovery tips
node.description: As more Covid-19 boosters are being given around the country plenty of suggestions have turned up on how to make it a little more pleasant. But which work and which are myths? Audio

node.title: Scientists discover rare asteroid that follows Earth in orbit
node.description: The Earth Trojan asteroid, only the second one proven by scientists to exist, orbits the sun along the same path as Earth.

node.title: Rise in crime fueled in part by "ghost" guns, ATF says
node.description: "Ghost" guns are unregistered and untraceable homemade weapons that can be made with a 3D printer.

node.title: Body found in North Shore's Lake Pupuke
node.description: The man was reportedly swimming with a friend on Tuesday night and got into trouble.

node.title: Twelve-year-old boy pleads not guilty to murder of Northland man
node.description: A 12-year-old accused of murdering a man near Kaikohe has pleaded not guilty in the High Court in Whangārei this morning.

node.title: NASA delays Artemis moon launch rehearsal till March
node.description: NASA says engineers need more time to complete preparations before "wet dress rehearsal" at the launch pad.

node.title: Super Rugby Pacific teams to move to Queenstown
node.description: New Zealand Rugby has confirmed it will move all six New Zealand based Super Rugby Pacific sides to Queenstown for the next month and possibly more.

node.title: NPC teams to play for one title
node.description: There will no longer be a Premiership and Championship in provincial rugby with all 14 teams now competing for one title.

node.title: Person admitted to Wellington Hospital tests positive for Covid-19
node.description: The Capital and Coast DHB has confirmed a person tested positive for Covid-19 while at Wellington Hospital yesterday.

node.title: How Ben Ray Luján's absence could affect the Senate's agenda
node.description: While Luján is recovering from a stroke he suffered last week, Senate Democrats will not have enough votes to pass legislation on their own.

node.title: Republicans Who Voted to Impeach Trump Out-Raised Primary Rivals
node.description: Despite their pariah status in their party, House Republicans who broke with the former president have raised more than their G.O.P. foes.

node.title: N.Y. Democrats advance new congressional map that heavily favors partyy
node.description: Their map could result in four fewer Republicans in the state's congressional delegation.

node.title: Starbucks to raise prices for the third time since October
node.description: Prices at fast-food restaurants jumped 8% last year. But corporate profits are also getting a bump through higher menu charges.

node.title: Ukraine is NZ's 'us too' moment
node.description: The Detail - Russian troops are gathering on Ukraine's border and diplomatic efforts to resolve the situation have done nothing to cool things down.

node.title: Scientists keen to find out how 'forever' chemicals got into urban water systems
node.description: Longlasting pollutants linked to health scares overseas have been found in this country's urban water systems for the first time.
